faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Introductory course for a student interested in archaeology. No prior knowledge of archaeology is required.
description.et: Sissejuhatav aine inglise keeles arheoloogiahuvilisele tudengile. Aines osalemine ei eelda arheoloogia-alaseid teadmisi.

learning_outcomes.en: Will know how material culture is studied in Estonia. They will be able to introduce one of the archaeological sites/finds of their country. They will be able to discuss the topics of two major processes that have taken place ona smaller scale (in the context of Estonia). Knows the research techniques of archaeology.
learning_outcomes.et: Teab, kuidas materiaalset kultuuri Eestis uuritakse. Tutvustab ühte oma riigi arheoloogilist muistist. Arutleb kuidas on toimunud kaks suuremat protsessi väikses kontekstis Eesti näitel. Teab arheoloogia uurimisalaseid võtteid.

independent_work.en: Answering questions based on the reading material; a presentation or written work on the archaeological site/find of your country. Giving feedback to another student's work. More info will be available on Moodle before the beginning of the course.
independent_work.et: Lugemismaterjalide põhjal küsimustele vastamine; ettekanne või kirjatükk oma riigi muistisest. Teise tudengi töö tagasisidestamine. Lisainfo tuleb Moodlesse kui kursuse algus läheneb.

grade_preconditions.en: The subject is counted as passed if the student has: participated in 8 out of 10 contact seminars and submitted all independent works.
grade_preconditions.et: Õppeaine on arvestatud kui tudeng on: osalenud 10-st 8-s kontakttunnis, esitanud kõik iseseisvad tööd.

grade_evaluation.en: The subject is counted as passed if the student has: participated in 8 out of 10 contact seminars and submitted all independent works.
grade_evaluation.et: Õppeaine on arvestatud kui tudeng on: osalenud 10-st 8-s kontakttunnis, esitanud kõik iseseisvad tööd.

arvestatud.en: The subject is counted as passed if the student has: participated in 8 out of 10 contact seminars and submitted all independent works.
arvestatud.et: Õppeaine on arvestatud kui üliõpilane on: osalenud 10-st 8-s kontakttunnis, esitanud kõik iseseisvad tööd.

mittearvestatud.en: The subject is counted as not passed if the student has missed more than 2 contact seminars and/or not submitted all independent works.
mittearvestatud.et: Aine loetakse mittearvestatuks, kui üliõpilane on jätnud vahele rohkem kui 2 kontaktseminari ja/või ei ole esitanud kõiki iseseisvaid töid.

mitteilmunud.en: If the student has missed more than 5 seminars and/or has not submitted all independent works.
mitteilmunud.et: Aine loetakse mitteilmunuks kui üliõpilane jätab vahele rohkem kui 5 kontaktseminari ja/või ei ole esitanud kõiki iseseisvaid töid.

structural_unit.address:
Ravila 14a
50411 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Introduction to the course. How do the archaeologists know where to dig? Material culture: what can we learn from artefacts, art, and symbols? Methods, everything we have capabilities for in UT.
description.et: Introduction to the course. How do the archaeologists know where to dig? Material culture: what can we learn from artefacts, art, and symbols? Methods, everything we have capabilities for in UT.

topic.en: Estonian history from 10 000 BC to today
topic.et: Estonian history from 10 000 BC to today

description.en: Independent work: read the text and write out two thoughts. There will be a discussion in the lecture based on your thoughts.
description.et: Independent work: read the text and write out two thoughts. There will be a discussion in the lecture based on your thoughts.

topic.en: Large processes on a closer look I - the Viking Age in Estonia
topic.et: Large processes on a closer look I - the Viking Age in Estonia

description.en: Independent work: read the text and write out two thoughts. There will be a discussion in the seminar.
We will use local Estonian clay to make small clay figurines using ancient methods. A clay firing session will be organised later during the course.
description.et: We will use local Estonian clay to make small clay figurines using ancient methods. A clay firing session will be organised later during the course.

topic.en: Large processes on a closer look II
topic.et: Large processes on a closer look II

description.en: Independent work: read the text and write out two thoughts. There will be a discussion in the seminar.
description.et: Independent work: read the text and write out two thoughts. There will be a discussion in the seminar.

description.en: The seminar will teach you to analyse archaeological finds and put them into context. You will be shown archaeological finds and asked to interpret them in a small group and then present your findings.
description.et: The seminar will teach you to analyse archaeological finds and put them into context. You will be shown archaeological finds and asked to interpret them in a small group and then present your findings.

topic.en: Tour of the facilities at Jakobi 2
topic.et: Tour of the facilities at Jakobi 2

description.en: Seeing all the possibilities our archaeology department has. Meeting other academic employees at Jakobi 2.
description.et: Seeing all the possibilities our archaeology department has. Meeting other academic employees at Jakobi 2.

description.en: Topic of the seminar may vary. Prepare for a bingo and some  information on giving and receiving feedback.
description.et: Topic of the seminar may vary. Prepare for a bingo and some  information on giving and receiving feedback.

description.en: Choose one student's topic beforehand and prepare to give feedback.
description.et: Choose one student's topic beforehand and prepare to give feedback.

description.en: Guided tour of what's underneath this city.
description.et: Guided tour of what's underneath this city.
